noun.description: A referee or official who is thought to favor the team playing at home.

examples: he homered for the sixth time in seven games

proper noun.description: (8th century BC), Greek epic poet. He is traditionally held to be the author of the Iliad and the Odyssey, although modern scholarship has revealed the place of the Homeric poems in a preliterate oral tradition. In later antiquity, Homer was regarded as the greatest poet, and his poems were constantly used as a model and source by others.

phrases: As a result, I have tended to steer clear of the play, thinking that, if Homer sometimes nods (as the old saying has it), then here at any rate, Shakespeare was deeply asleep!
Perhaps, endowed as he was with such excellent powers of perception, he should have sensed the presence of an enemy; but even the worthy Homer sometimes nods.
Yes, it was created by top, well loved developers but even Homer sometimes nods, and he has here.
I'd comfort myself with our old prep school saying, quandoque bonus dormitat Homerus, even the worthy Homer sometimes nods.
It serves no useful purpose for the writer to remind himself that even Homer sometimes nods.
